procos_colors <- c("#94bfa2", "#7C563A", "#61A60E", "#99ccff", "#cce5ff")


# 1. Department and Production Lines (Waffle-style visualization)
dept_data <- data.frame(
  category = c("Departments", "Production Lines", "Employees (x100)"),
  count = c(6, 50, 5),
  color = c(procos_colors[1], procos_colors[2], procos_colors[3])
)

p1 <- ggplot(dept_data, aes(x = reorder(category, count), y = count, fill = category)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.7, show.legend = FALSE) +
  geom_text(aes(label = ifelse(category == "Employees (x100)", "500+", count)),

    plot.margin = margin(20, 20, 20, 20)
  ) +
  ylim(0, max(dept_data$count) * 1.2)

# 2. Production Capacity (Donut chart approach)
capacity_data <- data.frame(
  category = c("Reactor \nCapacity", "Accessory \nEquipment"),
  volume = c(560, 200),
  color = c(procos_colors[1], procos_colors[4])
)

capacity_data$fraction <- capacity_data$volume / sum(capacity_data$volume)
capacity_data$ymax <- cumsum(capacity_data$fraction)
capacity_data$ymin <- c(0, head(capacity_data$ymax, n = -1))
capacity_data$label_position <- (capacity_data$ymax + capacity_data$ymin) / 2
capacity_data$label <- paste0(capacity_data$category, "\n", capacity_data$volume, " mÂ³")


p2 <- ggplot(capacity_data, aes(x = volume, y = reorder(category, volume), fill = category)) +

## **Global Reach, Italian Roots**

Acquired by a Japanese company in 2006, PROCOS maintains its headquarters and R&D center here in Italy while operating sales offices across five continents.\

```{r}
#| echo: false

library(geosphere)
library(maps)
library(showtext)

# Define office locations
locations <- data.frame(
  city = c("Italy", "New York", "Germany", "Slovakia", "India", "Tokyo"),
  lon = c(8.6218, -74.0060, 10.4515, 19.6990, 78.9629, 139.6917),
  lat = c(45.4469, 40.7128, 51.1657, 48.6690, 20.5937, 35.6762),
  type = c("HQ/R&D/Factory", "Sales", "Sales", "Sales", "Sales", "Sales"),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

# Create connection routes from HQ (Italy) to all sales offices
hq_idx <- which(locations$city == "Italy")
sales_idx <- which(locations$type == "Sales")

# Generate great circle routes
all_routes <- data.frame()
for(i in sales_idx) {
  route <- gcIntermediate(
    c(locations$lon[hq_idx], locations$lat[hq_idx]),
    c(locations$lon[i], locations$lat[i]),
    n = 100,
    addStartEnd = TRUE,
    sp = FALSE
  )
  route <- as.data.frame(route)
  route$group <- paste(locations$city[hq_idx], locations$city[i], sep = "-")
  all_routes <- rbind(all_routes, route)
}

# ============ START PNG EXPORT ============
# Open PNG device
png(filename = "procos_global_network.png",
    width = 3000,      # Width in pixels
    height = 2000,     # Height in pixels
    res = 300)         # Resolution (DPI)


# Create the map
#Margin parameter
par(mar = c(0, 0, 4, 0),
        oma = c(0, 0, 0, 0),  # Outer margins
    bg = "#F1F7FA", family = "Tsukimi-Rounded")

# Plot base world map
maps::map(database = "world", col = "#e8e8e8", fill = TRUE, border = "#cccccc", 
    ylim = c(0, 70), xlim = c(-100, 150))

# Add connection lines
for(group in unique(all_routes$group)) {
  route_data <- all_routes[all_routes$group == group, ]
  lines(route_data$lon, route_data$lat, 
        col = "#7AB8D7", lwd = 1.5, lty = 1)
}

# Add office points
points(locations$lon[hq_idx], locations$lat[hq_idx], 
       pch = 21, cex = 3, col = "#61A60E", bg = "#61A60E", lwd = 2)
points(locations$lon[sales_idx], locations$lat[sales_idx], 
       pch = 21, cex = 2, col = "#7C563A", bg = "#7C563A", lwd = 2)

# Add labels with flags and adjusted positions
# Italy - moved down to avoid overlap
text(locations$lon[hq_idx], locations$lat[hq_idx] - 10, 
     labels = paste0(locations$flag[hq_idx], " Italy\n(HQ/R&D/Factory)"), 
     cex = 0.8, font = 2, col = "#61A60E", family = "Tsukimi-Rounded", )

# Sales offices with flags
for(i in sales_idx) {
  # Adjust position for each city to avoid overlap
  pos_adjust <- if(locations$city[i] == "Germany") 2 else 3
  offset <- if(locations$city[i] == "Slovakia") 4 else 2
  
  text(locations$lon[i], locations$lat[i] + offset, 
       labels = paste0( " ", locations$city[i], "\n(Sales)"), 
       pos = pos_adjust, font = 2, cex = 0.7, col = "#7C563A", 
       family = "Tsukimi-Rounded")
}

# Add title
title(main = "PROCOS Global Office Network", 
      cex.main = 1.5, font.main = 2, col.main = "#333333",
      family = "Tsukimi-Rounded")

# Add legend
legend("bottomleft", 
       legend = c("HQ/R&D/Factory", "Sales Office", "Connection"), 
       pch = c(21, 21, NA), 
       lty = c(NA, NA, 1),
       col = c("#61A60E", "#7C563A", "#7AB8D7"),
       pt.bg = c("#61A60E", "#7C563A", NA),
       pt.cex = c(2, 1.5, NA),
       lwd = c(2, 2, 1.5),
       bty = "n",
       cex = 0.8,
       text.font = 1,
       inset = c(0.01, 0.01)
       )
# Close the PNG device - THIS IS IMPORTANT!
dev.off()
# ============ END PNG EXPORT ============

# The file will be saved in your working directory
# Check where it saved:
print(paste("File saved to:", getwd()))

```
